answers.answer: HiWelcome to the MedHelp forum!Unexplained aches and pains coming on and off could be due to rheumatoid arthritis, lupus, Crohn’s disease (if she has bowel problems), H pylori infection, anemia, liver disorders, diabetes, hypothyroidism, Vit B12 or Vit D deficiency and due to calcium or magnesium deficiency. It can also be due to sleep related disorders.Only headache on left side can be due to dental pain, ear infection, migraine or even due to near or shortsightedness.Do discuss this with her pediatrician. Take care!

question: My 7 year old daugher had meningitis at the age of 8 months old, and had to have a craniotomy on the left side of her head to remove pus.  Just recently she has complained of pain on the left side of her head, the pain does not last long.  Her pediatrician was thinking it was seizures and ordered an eeg which came back normal.  The pain also goes to different parts of her body and are painful.  What is going on?
title: Pain in the head
